page.title: 04FARMING
page.content:
In the 1801 census the population of the area was 290 and in the origional Domesday survey 32 people were counted.
The rise in population in the 1800s reflects the changes in farming practice introduced to the area by the {Dukes of Bedford}from nearby{Woburn {Abbey.}The Dukes took advantage of any new method or improvements in farming machinery as soon as they were introduced.
The farms in the area today are large and highly efficient. During the survey in October 1985 two of the 1km by 1km squares in the 12 km block were entirely ploughed and planted. The ploughing also included two{public {rights of way!
